introducao: Bem-vindo ao treino de Listening e Pronunciation sobre expressões do dia a dia!

Listening.text: hang out — significa sair ou passar tempo com amigos de maneira relaxada.
hang out
I usually hang out with my friends on weekends.
Let’s hang out after work.
They’re hanging out at the mall right now.
get out — significa sair de um lugar, especialmente de forma rápida ou inesperada.
get out
It started raining, so we got out of the pool.
Get out of the car, please.
He told me to get out of his office.
go out — significa sair para algum lugar, especialmente para lazer ou compromissos.
go out
We usually go out for dinner on Fridays.
Are you going out tonight?
They went out to watch a movie.
to have fun — significa se divertir, aproveitar o momento.
to have fun
We always have fun when we travel together.
Have fun at the party!
They are having fun playing games.
seldom — significa raramente, usado para algo que acontece com pouca frequência.
seldom
I seldom eat junk food.
She seldom goes to the cinema.
We seldom stay up late during the week.
invite — significa convidar alguém para um evento ou atividade.
invite
He invited me to his birthday party.
Did you invite your coworkers to the meeting?
They invited us for dinner last night.
take a look — significa dar uma olhada, observar rapidamente algo.
take a look
Take a look at this photo!
Can you take a look at my report?
I’ll take a look when I have time.
at the subject — significa sobre o assunto, usado para indicar o tema de uma conversa ou estudo.
at the subject
Let’s look at the subject more carefully.
The teacher asked us to focus at the subject.
I’m not good at the subject of math.
a few hours — significa algumas horas, período curto de tempo.
a few hours
I’ll be there in a few hours.
It took a few hours to finish the project.
She studied for a few hours before the test.
last but not least — significa por último, mas não menos importante.
last but not least
Last but not least, I’d like to thank my parents.
And last but not least, let’s talk about teamwork.
Last but not least, remember to enjoy yourself.
every now and then — significa de vez em quando, ocasionalmente.
every now and then
I like to go hiking every now and then.
Every now and then, I watch an old movie.
He checks his email every now and then.
every now and again — tem o mesmo sentido que 'every now and then', significando de vez em quando.
every now and again
We have lunch together every now and again.
Every now and again, she visits her old friends.
It’s good to take a break every now and again.
